Headline: Strategy, GTM & Ops | Ex Founder's Office @ OTPLESS | Prev: Zomato, Deloitte USI, EY
Comment:
This hit hard.
Because the truth is - growth is addictive.

You start confusing momentum with strength.
Investor interest, rising demand, positive CACs - it‚Äôs validating, yes. But it can also blind you.

Because growth hides cracks.
You might be acquiring customers, but are they coming back?
You might be shipping more, but are your ops quietly bleeding margin?
You might be expanding, but are your systems - your team, tech, supply chain - ready for what you‚Äôre asking of them?

Everyone wants to scale. Few are ready to sustain that scale.
That‚Äôs why this idea matters.

Because pausing isn't weakness - it‚Äôs control.
It‚Äôs asking the hard questions before your growth breaks you.

The most resilient brands aren‚Äôt obsessed with velocity. They‚Äôre obsessed with alignment.

Because speed without stability = noise.
And discipline? That‚Äôs what turns growth into legacy.
